text: No acute intracranial abnormality. Mild chronic small vessel ischemic changes. Paranasal sinuses and mastoid air cells are clear.
Comparison made to prior study dated November fifteenth. The previously noted right lower lobe consolidation has significantly improved with only minimal residual scarring.
Multiple punctate foci of restricted diffusion scattered throughout the bilateral cerebral hemispheres consistent with acute embolic infarcts.
There is a 2.3 centimeter enhancing mass in the right hepatic lobe segment seven demonstrating arterial hyperenhancement with washout on delayed phases.
The gallbladder is distended with wall thickening measuring up to 5 millimeters and pericholecystic fluid. Multiple shadowing gallstones are noted.
There is moderate degenerative disc disease at L4-L5 with disc desiccation and loss of disc height. Mild bilateral facet arthropathy without significant central canal stenosis.
Large heterogeneously enhancing mass centered in the right parotid gland measuring 4.2 by 3.8 by 3.5 centimeters with areas of internal necrosis.
The patient is status post anterior cervical discectomy and fusion at C5-C6. Hardware appears intact without evidence of loosening or migration.
Acute appendicitis with periappendiceal inflammatory changes and fluid. No drainable collection identified. Surgical consultation recommended.
Interval development of moderate right pleural effusion with associated compressive atelectasis. Recommend thoracentesis for symptomatic relief.
Redemonstrated is a complex left renal cyst with thick septations and nodular enhancement concerning for Bosniak category three lesion.
Bilateral ground glass opacities in a peripheral and basilar distribution typical for COVID pneumonia. No pleural effusion or pneumothorax.
MRI brain without and with contrast shows no evidence of metastatic disease. Post surgical changes noted in the right frontal lobe from prior resection.
There is a nondisplaced fracture through the surgical neck of the right humerus. Alignment is anatomic. No significant soft tissue swelling.
New area of cortical thickening and periosteal reaction along the mid diaphysis of the left femur. Consider MRI for further evaluation.
Moderate concentric left ventricular hypertrophy without focal wall motion abnormality. Ejection fraction visually estimated at sixty percent.
Stable appearance of the known left upper lobe spiculated nodule measuring 1.8 centimeters. Recommend continued surveillance in six months.
No evidence of pulmonary embolism to the subsegmental level. Incidental note made of enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes measuring up to 1.5 centimeters.
The pancreas demonstrates diffuse parenchymal atrophy with main pancreatic duct dilatation measuring up to 8 millimeters suggestive of chronic pancreatitis.
Large left sided subdural hematoma measuring up to 2.3 centimeters with 8 millimeter midline shift. Neurosurgical consultation obtained.
The liver demonstrates geographic areas of fatty infiltration. No focal hepatic lesion identified. Portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow.
CT angiogram negative for aortic dissection or intramural hematoma. Atherosclerotic calcifications noted throughout the thoracic and abdominal aorta.
Full thickness tear of the supraspinatus tendon with retraction to the level of the glenoid. Moderate muscle atrophy present.
Interval placement of right chest tube with improved pneumothorax now only minimal apical component remaining. Lung re-expansion noted.
Multifocal areas of marrow signal abnormality throughout the visualized skeleton concerning for osseous metastatic disease versus multiple myeloma.
Bilateral adrenal nodules noted with the left measuring 2.8 centimeters demonstrating washout characteristics consistent with adenomas.
Prominent lymph nodes in the right axilla with loss of fatty hilum largest measuring 2.5 centimeters. Recommend tissue sampling.
Small amount of free fluid in the pelvis. Both ovaries appear normal. No adnexal mass identified. Clinical correlation recommended.
Bilateral knee x-rays demonstrate moderate tricompartmental osteoarthritis worse on the right with joint space narrowing and marginal osteophytes.
Histopathology demonstrated Rosai-Dorfman disease with emperipolesis of histiocytes.
High-resolution MRI identified leptomeningeal melanocytosis with diffuse T1 hyperintensity along the cerebellar folia.
CT imaging showed dendriform pulmonary ossification presenting as branching calcific densities in the lung parenchyma.
The urinary bladder is distended with smooth wall thickening. Bilateral hydroureteronephrosis present. Foley catheter placement recommended.
Ultrasound elastography suggested hepatic involvement by fibrolamellar carcinoma featuring lamellar fibrosis.
Genomic profiling revealed a pathogenic fusion involving the EWSR1 gene characteristic of clear cell sarcoma.
PET-CT uncovered hypermetabolism in a hemangiopericytoma seated at the cerebellopontine angle.
Whole-body diffusion-weighted MRI highlighted multifocal Langerhans cell histiocytosis with punched-out skull lesions.
MRI spectroscopy detected elevated taurine peaks in a medulloblastoma of the desmoplastic/nodular subtype.
Serial CT enterography demonstrated mural thickening and sacculations in jejunal segments typical of jejunal diverticulosis with pneumatosis cystoides intestinalis.
Cardiac MRI disclosed left ventricular noncompaction characterized by a noncompacted to compacted myocardial ratio exceeding 2.3.
MR neurography revealed hourglass-like constriction of the suprascapular nerve implicating neuralgic amyotrophy.
High-resolution CT delineated pulmonary alveolar microlithiasis with diffuse sand-like calcifications.
CT urography showed a papillary tumor consistent with inverted papilloma of the renal pelvis.
Endoscopic ultrasound-guided biopsy confirmed solid pseudopapillary neoplasm of the pancreas harboring CTNNB1 mutation.
Magnetic resonance venography demonstrated cerebral venous sinus thrombosis secondary to Behçet's disease.
Bone scintigraphy exhibited the 'hot skull' sign in polyostotic Paget disease involving the calvarium.
PET-MRI illustrated hypermetabolic foci in myxoid/round cell liposarcoma with translocation t(12;16)(q13;p11).
MRI orbital study exhibited an expansile lesion with flow voids consistent with lymphangioma featuring intralesional hemorrhage.
Cone-beam CT of the temporal bone depicted superior semicircular canal dehiscence with tympanic facial nerve aberrancy.
Transthoracic echocardiography demonstrated hypertrophic obstructive cardiomyopathy with systolic anterior motion of the mitral valve and resting gradient of 85 mmHg.
Next-generation sequencing identified pathogenic variants in BRCA2 and PALB2 genes conferring hereditary breast and ovarian cancer syndrome.
Dual-energy CT characterized crystal deposition consistent with tophaceous pseudogout involving the atlantoaxial joint.
Multiparametric MRI revealed infiltrating ductal carcinoma with peritumoral lymphovascular invasion and axillary lymphadenopathy measuring 2.3 cm.

We conducted a retrospective cohort study of 3,847 patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus who underwent metformin monotherapy between January 2018 and December 2022. Patients achieving HbA1c <7.0% at 6 months demonstrated significantly reduced risk of microvascular complications (HR 0.68, 95% CI 0.54-0.82, p<0.001)
Optical coherence tomography angiography detected choroidal neovascularization secondary to pathologic myopia with subfoveal fluid accumulation.
Cerebral angiography revealed moyamoya disease with characteristic puff of smoke appearance and transdural collateralization.
Fluorodeoxyglucose PET-CT revealed hypermetabolic mediastinal lymphadenopathy consistent with sarcoidosis demonstrating lambda sign.
Magnetic resonance cholangiopancreatography demonstrated primary sclerosing cholangitis with multifocal biliary strictures and beaded appearance.
Endobronchial ultrasound-guided transbronchial needle aspiration confirmed small cell lung carcinoma with neuroendocrine differentiation.
High-resolution manometry revealed type II achalasia with panesophageal pressurization and incomplete lower esophageal sphincter relaxation.
Dynamic contrast-enhanced MRI showed hepatocellular carcinoma with arterial phase hyperenhancement and portal venous washout meeting LI-RADS 5 criteria.
Electromyography demonstrated acute inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy with conduction block and temporal dispersion characteristic of Guillain-Barré syndrome.
Capsule endoscopy identified angiodysplasia in the jejunum with active oozing requiring argon plasma coagulation therapy.
Immunohistochemistry revealed diffuse large B-cell lymphoma expressing CD20, BCL6, and MUM1 with Ki-67 proliferation index of 90%.
Temporal artery biopsy confirmed giant cell arteritis with transmural inflammation and multinucleated giant cells disrupting the internal elastic lamina.
Renal biopsy showed focal segmental glomerulosclerosis with collapsing variant and extensive podocyte foot process effacement on electron microscopy.
Cardiac catheterization demonstrated severe three-vessel coronary artery disease with chronic total occlusion of the right coronary artery and SYNTAX score of 38.
Video-EEG monitoring captured focal seizures originating from the mesial temporal lobe with secondary generalization and post-ictal aphasia.
Contrast-enhanced ultrasound demonstrated portal vein thrombosis with cavernous transformation and hepatopetal collateral circulation.
Muscle biopsy revealed inclusion body myositis with rimmed vacuoles and TDP-43 positive cytoplasmic inclusions on immunofluorescence.
Flow cytometry identified acute promyelocytic leukemia with t(15;17) translocation expressing CD13, CD33, and aberrant CD56.
Positron emission mammography detected multifocal invasive lobular carcinoma with skip lesions and contralateral synchronous ductal carcinoma in situ.
Dacryocystography revealed complete nasolacrimal duct obstruction with presaccal stenosis requiring dacryocystorhinostomy.
Skin biopsy demonstrated bullous pemphigoid with subepidermal blister formation and linear IgG deposition along the basement membrane zone.
Cystoscopy with blue light imaging identified carcinoma in situ with positive photodiagnosis using hexaminolevulinate fluorescence.
Transesophageal echocardiography revealed papillary fibroelastoma on the aortic valve with mobile frond-like projections measuring 8 mm.
Vestibular evoked myogenic potentials showed absent responses bilaterally consistent with bilateral vestibulopathy secondary to gentamicin ototoxicity.
Bronchoscopy with endobronchial biopsy confirmed carcinoid tumor expressing chromogranin A and synaptophysin with low Ki-67 index.
Endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography revealed type I choledochal cyst with anomalous pancreaticobiliary junction.
Synovial fluid analysis revealed calcium pyrophosphate dihydrate crystals with positive birefringence confirming pseudogout affecting the knee joint.
Lymphoscintigraphy demonstrated primary lymphedema with dermal backflow pattern and absent visualization of inguinal lymph nodes.
Arthroscopy revealed pigmented villonodular synovitis with hemosiderin-laden synovial proliferation and characteristic nodular appearance.
Perfusion MRI demonstrated luxury perfusion in the penumbra surrounding acute ischemic stroke with mismatch ratio exceeding 1.8.
Quantitative sensory testing demonstrated small fiber neuropathy with thermal hypoesthesia and paradoxical heat sensation.
Liver elastography measured hepatic stiffness of 21.5 kPa consistent with F4 fibrosis and portal hypertension in chronic hepatitis C.
